Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2018 12:44PM SAAdvocate wrote: Welp, here I am. My co-workers would likely feel that this won't help me maintain a positive outlook, but sometimes you just need to connect with people that really do "get it." I've been having yearly mammograms since I was 25, as my mom had a very aggressive breast cancer when she was 40 and the doctors recommended early screenings for her daughters. Well, a couple weeks ago my screening mammo found some calcifications. I had a diagnostic mammo done a few days later and the doctor recommended we do biopsies - given how the calcifcations presented and the family history. I had the biopsies done last Wednesday (wow! That was anxiety inducing) and Friday I got my results. I have ADH.. and will be referred to a surgeon at our local Breast Center. I'm trying to focus on the fact that it's not cancer. But it's hard knowing it's *so close* to cancer. My mom actually had ADH years before cancer showed up. I'm just a little freaked out, and thought it might be beneficial to get connected to people who understand my fears.
